comment:
Class was easy if you stay on top of things, never gives 100s. Instructions for major projects are vague and takes points off if you don't meet his standards which he doesn't articulate.

Will re-open things if you miss and email.
I would definitely take this professor again. The class is easy

Assignments were super easy (discussion posts and simple projects for tests) and the professor seemed pretty nice. My only complaint was that he didn't grade the major grades until a few days before the semester ended.

The textbook that is required for this course is not useful since a few of the assignments refers to the textbook but can still be done using the information in the powerpoints, articles and videos provided. Most of the assignments are discussion posts and projects.

Really easy course, it's not hard to get an A, but he is so hard to contact. I'm a fully virtual student and live in Florida and I got no response when I informed him my town was going to get hit by a hurricane and that I might need an extension on an assignment if I lost power. Don't buy the textbook, you don't need it.

Bad at staying on class topic (got political), never gave 100s, and only ever used one chapter from the book he requires you to purchase. While the class is a breeze, the Prof is so frustrating I would not take this class again.

Did not stay on class topic (science and tech in society) and was a horrible grader. He once took points off my grade for a module because I forgot the checklist even though I turned in the actual work on time. Never gives 100s.

Great teacher and an easy class. A week is usually a couple of videos and reading a PowerPoint or an article with an assignment. The assignment is just a discussion or a simple project. Takes about an hour out of your week for this class. Definitely recommend.

I took his online course. Easy class. There are at most six- seven assignments for each module. Including videos, articles, activities, reflection, and games. Complete 1 module a week. You could knock out all the assignments in 2 hours honestly. Just follow his guidelines for the assignments and cite where you got your sources, and you are good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I enjoyed that class.  The syllabus was clear and easy to follow.  I was able to get in touch with him by cell phone and email.  I saw the bad reviews, but my experience was excellent.  To my understanding, many of the issues students complained about were due to the pandemic and COVID, not based on the effectiveness of Dr. Watkins.

Dr. Watkins is an excellent professor that shows compassion and concern for his students.  The online textbook he created during the pandemic was informative and insightful.  Although some of my classmates complained, he provided an alternative option when supply chain issues prevented students from purchasing a previously used textbook.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Watkins heart clearly wasn't in it this semester. The book and quizes were nearly incomprehensible and filled with many errors. He was uncommunative and graded assignments last minute like literally at the very end of the course. Wouldn't recommend him to anyone.

First off Dr. Watkins makes you buy his own book... He waited last minute to grade all the assignments. Didn't know what grade I was expecting until 2 weeks before the course ended. Never got back to me regarding a very important, time-sensitive issue. What can I say, probably doesn't care about his students.

Terrible at communication. Would rarely answer emails and when he did, it was nonsense just to get you to stop emailing him. Many assignments had incorrect rubrics or were overly tedious for no reason. Online textbook questions were filled with errors and he never corrected them. Major assignments not graded till final due date. Avoid at all cost.

Super easy class as long as you do what is asked of you on time! Short weekly discussion posts, module completion checklists and 5 term projects that weren't at all complicated or hard. No tests or quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great professor, he makes assignments fun and easy! I thoroughly enjoyed his class, was a breath of fresh air in comparison to other professors.

Super easy class. Material is easy (just d2l modules and some sparse short quizzes) and prof pretty lenient on when you turn things in. Enjoyed his class. Just make sure to do the discussion posts for the easy grade (they really matter). I never used the textbooks really. Just read the mini powerpoint he posts with the youtube vids
Enjoyed him coaching me to improve on major assignments during optional Zoom session.
Relatable to things I have previously learned and allowed me to expand on those things. Many opportunities to do work and be successful in his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Learned a lot about the Environment and policies about global issues
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Watkins is my favorite professor!

Dr. Watkins is an excellent professor. Some students complained about the level of reading and the work becuase they are lazy. He is well prepared and very knowledgeable about the elementary education STEM and science content.
We completed lots of activities that I will be able to use for my first year of teaching next year. Enjoyed group projects and Professor Watkins is very knowledgeable of STEM.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Enjoyed engaging group projects! Also work was aligned to preparation for EdTPA

TERRIBLE TEACHER. He doesn't know the content at all and constantly says he have to "ask the teacher that created the course shell." He's constantly off task and never teaches the right information for the reflections. The reflections??? BOGUS. The articles are ridiculously long for no reason at all. DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Thanks for making sure I was ready for my 1st year to teach.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Dr. Watkins prepared me to be a great teacher this semester!
I enjoyed Dr. Watkins this semester. He is a positive professor who is experienced and made sure I will be prepared for my 1st year teaching.
Kind and caring, but overworked and not prepared. Pulls grades out of nowhere and spends half his lecture time looking for resources or out on unrelated tangents.

I don't think Professor Watkins was properly trained (last minute hire before the semester started) so I think that's why he was not a great professor. If you need an easy A, take him but don't expect to learn much. You can skip every class and it won't matter as long as you turn assignments in. He also doesn't grade til the end of the semester
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Watkins is a super caring guy, he provided me with great advice when it came to career planning. The content of the class was not covered well but he is aware that he is still learning the program & leaves room for a lot of understanding when it comes to due dates and confusion. The downside is I do not feel super prepared to teach STEM.

Dr. Watkins has extensive experience in the education field. He's great to talk to about career planning. As a professor he didn't seem in control or knowledgeable about the assignments we were doing. He said the entire course was designed by someone else & he would always have to ask them questions before getting back to us. He wasn't prepared.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY
